usefulItems: springform cake tin (20 cm), baking paper, wooden skewer, fine mesh sieve, oven
title: Whole orange cake with spiced syrup

ingredients.content: 200 g unsalted butter, cut into pieces, plus extra for greasing
1 orange, washed, unpeeled and cut into quarters
1 orange, zest only, no white pith

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 180°C. Grease and line a springform cake tin (20 cm) with baking paper and set aside.
Place butter and orange into mixing bowl and blend <b>15 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula, then blend for a further <b>5 sec/speed 8<b>.
Add all remaining cake ingredients and mix <b>10 sec/speed 5<b>. Mix contents of mixing bowl well with spatula, then mix for a further <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.
Pour mixture into prepared cake tin, then bake for 50-60 minutes (180°C), or until a wooden skewer inserted into the centre of the cake comes out clean.
Allow cake to cool (approx. 45 minutes), then remove from cake tin and set aside.
Place all syrup ingredients into mixing bowl and cook <b>9 min/100°C/speed 2<b>.
Allow to cool, then strain through a fine mesh sieve and set aside until required.
Using a wooden skewer, poke holes in the top of the cake and pour ⅓ of the spiced syrup over the top. Allow cake to absorb syrup for a few minutes, then slice and serve.

hintsAndTricks: Serve extra syrup in a jug or poured over pancakes, vanilla bean ice cream or mascarpone cheese another day.

As the whole orange is used in this recipe, look for unwaxed, organic oranges. If you cannot access these, ensure you scrub the outside of your oranges well to remove as much residue as possible from the zest.
